slide.title: "Rehab" Program becomes Official Part of Illinois

ul.li: GI Bill for World War 2 veterans.
Galesburg VA in 1948 had UI extension courses for soliders.
Soldiers in disabled (e.g. used wheelchairs) in World War 2 wanted to go to Illinois.
Initially rejected for adminision to Illinois based soley on disability.
Soldiers lobbied the state government and university administration to be admitted.
Had the highest grade pint average of all the houses on campus during first year on campus.
After 6 years the "Rehab" program offically changed from experimental (e.g. unfundex) to become an offical part (funded) program of the University of Illinois.
First post-secondary institution to provide a support service program enabling students with disabilities to attend.
Founded Delta Sigma Omicron (DSO, DIsabled Student Organization) to advocate for students with disabilities.
Organized the first organized national wheelchair sporting competitions.
First Paraolympian who won a gold medal was a UI graduate.
Research at Illinois was the basis for first architecutral accessibility ANSI standards which are still used today as part of the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA).
Beckwith program was first residential dorms for students need personal attendant services.
